title: Citigroup affiliates pay out to settle ‘false assurance’ charge
text:
Welcome to your preview of The Times Subscribe now Citigroup affiliates pay out to settle ‘false assurance’ charge Citigroup Global Markets and Citigroup Alternative Investments,agreed to bear all costs Craig Shepheard/Corbis Alexandra Frean Published 1 minute ago 
Two affiliates of Citigroup have agreed to pay nearly $180 million to settle charges that they misled investors in two hedge funds that their investment “walks like a bond, talks like a bond”, even though the funds were classified as carrying a significant risk to capital. 
The funds, which were marketed from 2002, later crumbled and collapsed during the financial crisis.Even as they were failing, the fund managers accepted about $110 million in additional investments from new investors and continued to recommend the funds as safe, low-risk investments.
